Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class ConcurrentBitSet

java.lang.Object
com.shouldis.bitset.BitSet
com.shouldis.bitset.ConcurrentBitSet
public final class ConcurrentBitSet
extends BitSet
Implementation of BitSet in which all methods capable of modifying the state of bits such as setWord(int, long), andWord(int, long), orWord(int, long), xorWord(int, long) are delegated to atomic-operations.

The use of atomic operations allows concurrent modification of this ConcurrentBitSet without any external synchronization at the cost of processing time. These opperations are done by the semantics of VarHandle.setVolatile(Object...).

All methods have behavior as specified by BitSet.

Author:
Aaron Shouldis
See Also:
BitSet

    • add

      public boolean add​(int index)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Ensures that the bit at the specified index is in the live state. If it is not, it will be changed.
      Overrides:

    • toggle

      public void toggle​(int from, int to)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Changes the state of all bits in the specified range to their respective opposites through an XOR operation. No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to.
      Overrides:
      toggle in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be toggled.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be toggled.

    • andWord

      public void andWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of an AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] &= mask;
      Overrides:
      andWord in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to perform the AND operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the AND operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.

    • randomize

      public void randomize​(XOrShift random, int from, int to)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Changes the state of all bits in the specified range randomly according to the density of the XOrShift random. In contrast to BitSet.xOrRandomize(XOrShift) and BitSet.xOrRandomize(XOrShift, int, int), this method preserves that density. When using a uniformly distributed XOrShift (as opposed to DensityXOrShift), this is unnecessary. No action is taken if from is greater than or equal to to.
      Overrides:
      randomize in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      random - the instance of XOrShift used to randomize.
      from - (inclusive) the index of the first bit to be randomized.
      to - (exclusive) the end of the range of bits to be randomized.
      See Also:
      DensityXOrShift

    • not

      public void not()
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Transforms each bit in this BitSet into the complement of its current state.
      Overrides:
      not in class BitSet
